page.title: 10LIFESTYLES
page.content: Most of the people living in Babcary seem to live a quiet life, only really going out of Babcary when shopping. Most people are retired in the middle of Babcary and enjoy gardening and garden parties. The people in Babcary are very "community-minded" and do their best to help each other. There is a "Home-Market" at one of the big houses every Saturday where they sell their own produce (cakes, vegetables and fruit). The farmers live an almost "clock-work" year: milking, sowing, harvesting, calving etc., and miss out on many special days like Christmas, because the cows must always be milked at the same time, and so on. Hazlegrovians also live a "clock-work" type of life, however they all have their holidays.
